description:
This 2-vehicle crash occurred within a "T" type intersection in a rural area during
                        daylight hours while raining. The straight three-lane east/westbound roadway included a center
                        left turn lane and was on a slight downhill grade for westbound traffic. The straight two-lane
                        north/southbound roadway was on a steeper downhill grade for southbound traffic and was
                        controlled by a stop sign. Both roadways were asphalt constructed and wet at the time of the
                        crash. The speed limit for the through roadway was 80 kph (50 mph).


                        Vehicle one (V1), a 2003 Oldsmobile Alero sedan driven by a 20 year-old female with one
                        passenger was traveling southbound beginning a left hand turn (eastbound). Vehicle two (V2), a
                        1995 Chevrolet K-1500 pickup driven by a 66 year-old male was traveling westbound in the #1 lane
                        when the driver saw V1 beginning to pull out from the side street. The driver of V2 tapped on
                        his brakes and steered left slightly but could not avoid V1 because of oncoming traffic. The
                        front of V2 struck the front of V1. At impact, V1 rotated clockwise and came to rest facing
                        north off the right side of the traffic lane in the intersection. V2 came to rest in the center
                        turn lane facing north. V1 was towed due to damage. V2 was driven from the scene after the flat
                        tire was changed.


                        The critical pre-crash event for V1 was coded: this vehicle traveling; turning left at
                        intersection. The critical reason for the critical pre-crash event was coded to V1 as a driver
                        related factor: inadequate surveillance (e.g., failed to look, looked but did not see). The
                        driver was not aware of V2's presence until she had already entered the intersection. The driver
                        was inattentive due to thinking about financial problems. An illegal maneuver was coded as an
                        associative factor due to ignoring the traffic control. This driver slowed to approximately 5
                        mph before entering the intersection and attempting a left turn. If she had stopped at the stop
                        sign she may have detected V2 before entering the intersection.


                        The critical pre-crash event for V2 was coded: other vehicle encroachment; from crossing street,
                        turning into opposite direction. The critical reason was not coded to this vehicle.
